metadata.title: BlockIP-Azure Firewall New Rule
metadata.description: This playbook uses the Azure Firewall connector to add IP Address to the Deny Network Rules collection based on the Microsoft Sentinel Incident
mainSteps:: When a new Sentinel incident is created:

1. An adaptive card is sent to the SOC channel, providing IP address, Virus Total report , showing list of existing firewalls in the Resource group and providing an option to block IP Address to Deny network rules collection or Ignore.

2. If SOC user confirms yes, the IP Address gets added to deny network rules collection and incident will get updates with endpoint information, summary of the action taken and virus total scan report.
3. Else, incident will get updates with endpoint information and summary of the action taken.
prerequisites: **This playbook template is based on Microsoft Sentinel Incident Trigger which is currently in Private Preview (Automation Rules).** You can change the trigger to the Sentinel Alert trigger in cases you are not part of the Private Preview.
1. Azure Firewall connector needs to be deployed prior to the deployment of this playbook under the same subscription. Relevant instructions can be found in the connector doc page.
2. Azure Firewall connector need to be authenticated with a Service Principal that has permissions over Azure Firewall. Relevant instructions can be found in the connector doc page.
3. This playbook will add new rules to existing Network Collections in Azure Firewalls in your subscription. Make sure you have such prior to running the playbook.
4.To use VirusTotal connector, get your Virus Totan API key. [ how to generate the API Key](https://developers.virustotal.com/v3.0/reference#getting-started)
postDeployment: Once deployment is complete, you will need to authorize each connection.
1. Click the Microsoft Sentinel connection resource
6. Repeat steps for other connection such as Teams connection and Virus Total (For authorizing the Virus Total API connection, the API Key needs to be provided)
7. Authorize the Azure Firewall custom connector by following the below mentioned steps.

c. Find the action with the name 'Lists all Azure Firewalls in a resource group', 'Gets the specified Azure Firewall', 'Creates or updates the specified Azure Firewall', 'Updates tags for Azure Firewall resource' in the workflow.
d. Click Change connection [ Enter Connection name, ClientId, SecretKey and TenantId captured from AAD. ]
1. In Microsoft Sentinel analytical rules should be configured to trigger an incident with IP Entity.
2. Configure the automation rules to trigger this playbook

metadata.description: Name of the Logic App or Playbook
Name of the custom connector which interacts with Azure Firewall. Cannot contain spaces.

clientSecret.defaultValue: <enter the Client secret of the application>

FinalRuleCollectionList.description: Variable to store the entire Network Rules collection

Append_to_choice_list.description: Append prepared Firewall and Rules collection list

Choice_list_-_Firewall_and_Rule_collecti.description: Prepare a choice list using the above formatted Output.

Select_Firewall_and_Rules_collection_nam.description: Select Firewall name and Rule collection name from the Azure Firewall response

For_each_Firewall.description: Iterate over each Firewall present from the Resource Group and Prepare a Firewall - Rules collection choice list to show in the Adaptive Card

Compose.description: Preparing an Array with SOC selected Firewall Options

body.message:
Azure Firewall Playbook performed the following action :-

IP Address :  @{items('For_each_IP_Address_Entity_from_Incident')?['Address']}

Virus Total Report  :

Country  :  @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['country']}
Continent : @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['continent']}
ASN : @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['asn']}
AS_Owner : @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['as_owner']}

Total Votes :-
 
 Malicious : @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['total_votes']?['malicious']}
 Positives Votes : @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['total_votes']?['harmless']}
 Negative Votes :  @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['total_votes']?['malicious']}
 Suspicious Votes: @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['last_analysis_stats']?['suspicious']}
 Number of reports saying that is Undetected : @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['last_analysis_stats']?['undetected']}
Network : @{body('Ip_scan_report_V3')?['data']?['attributes']?['network']}

Action Taken In Azure Firewall :-

Added IP Address @{items('For_each_IP_Address_Entity_from_Incident')?['Address']} to the below Azure Firewall Configuration :-

Firewall name :
Rule Collection name :
Rule name :

value.description: Block traffic based on source IPs and ports
value.name: @concat('Rule',utcNow('yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ'))

Assign_Rule.description: Variable to store the new rule with malicious IP Address reported

Assign_selected_Rules_present_from_Netwo.description: Variable to store the rules present in the selected network rules collection

Creates_or_updates_the_specified_Azure_F.description: Create a rule with in the specified Azure firewall

Excluded_selected_rules_collection_list_.description: Variable to store the above filtered collection

Filter_Network_rule_collection.description: Filter the network rule collection information based on the network rule collection selected in the Adaptive Card

Filter_network_collections_list_excludin.description: Filter the network collection list by excluding the selected rules collection

Final_Network_rules_collection_list.description: Append the selected rules collection list

Firewall_name.description: Reading the firewall name from the SOC selected Firewall Rule collection

Gets_the_specified_Azure_Firewall.description: Gets the specified Azure Firewall information from the Azure Firewall Connector

Join_the_New_Rule_to_the_selected_Rules_.description: Append the new rule to the filtered rule collection list which is selected in the Adaptive Card

Resource_Group_name.description: Reading the resource group name from the SOC selected Firewall Rule collection

Set_property_to_update_the_properties_wi.description: Update the existing  network rules collection with the composed new rule collection list

Set_property_to_update_the_rules_list_wi.description: Update the existing rules list with the composed new rules list

Store_Existing_Rule_collection_informati.description: Array to Store the existing rule collection information for the selected firewall

For_each_rules_collection_selected_from_.description: Add a new rule to the each Rules collection selected from Adaptive Card
